H0.text: A change in the direction of the car is the change that best describes acceleration of a car, because the motion of a car accelerating in a straight line differs from the motion of a car moving in a straight line at a constant speed.

H1.text: A change in the distance the car travels is the best description of acceleration of a car, because its motion in a straight line differs from that of a car moving at a constant speed.

H2.text: The change in velocity divided by the time for that change is the acceleration of a car moving in a straight line, which differs from the motion of a car moving at a constant speed.

H3.text: The change in the time for the car to travel a distance best describes the acceleration of a car, distinguishing it from the motion of a car moving in a straight line at a constant speed.

A4.text: Acceleration is defined as the change in velocity over time, not the change in distance traveled.
